revision.text:
{{coord|51.350|-1.993|display=title}} {{Infobox Museum |name = Wiltshire Museum |image = Wiltshire Heritage Museum, Potterne Road, Devizes - geograph.org.uk - 1022996.jpg |established = {{Start date|1873}} |location = Long Street, [[Devizes]], [[Wiltshire]], [[England]] |type = [[Archaeology Museum]], [[Museum#Natural history museums|History museum]] |visitors = |director = David Dawson |curator = Lisa Brown |website = {{URL|http://www.wiltshiremuseum.org.uk/|Wiltshire Museum Website}} |network = }}
The '''Wiltshire Museum''', formerly known as '''Wiltshire Heritage Museum''' and '''Devizes Museum''', is a museum, archive and library and art gallery in [[Devizes]], [[Wiltshire]], England. The museum was established and is still run by, the [[Wiltshire Archaeological and Natural History Society]] (WANHS), a registered charity founded in 1853. After the purchase of an old grammar school the museum was opened in 1873. Subsequently, it expanded into two [[Georgian architecture|Georgian]] houses on either side and still occupies this location today.<ref>{{cite web|title=About Wiltshire Museum|url=http://www.wiltshiremuseum.org.uk/about/|publisher=Wiltshire Archaeological and Natural History Society|accessdate=26 August 2015}}</ref>
The museum maintains a collection covering the [[archaeology]], [[art]], [[history]] and [[natural history]] of Wiltshire. This collection covers periods of history from as far back as the [[Palaeolithic]] and also includes [[Neolithic]], [[Bronze Age]], [[Ancient Rome|Roman]], [[Saxon]], [[Mediaeval]] and more recent historical artefacts.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Crooks|first1=Jill|title=Wiltshire museum bids to shed stuffy image|url=http://www.thisiswiltshire.co.uk/news/headlines/4225172.Wiltshire_museum_bids_to_shed_stuffy_image/|website=This is Wiltshire|accessdate=20 October 2015|date=23 March 2009}}</ref> Among the prehistoric collections are items from the [[Stonehenge and Avebury World Heritage Site]].<ref name="collections">{{cite press release |title=Designated Collections 2008 |url=http://www.mla.gov.uk/resources/assets//D/designation_list_july08_13493.pdf |publisher=The Museums, Libraries and Archives Council |date=July 2008 |accessdate=2008-10-22}}</ref> Several of the collections have been [[Designation Scheme|designated]] as being a significant part of England’s [[cultural heritage]].<ref name="collections" />
One of the most important collections at the museum is the finds from [[Bush Barrow]], an early Bronze Age [[Tumulus|burial mound]] in Stonehenge World Heritage Site. The barrow was excavated by [[William Cunnington]] in 1808 and produced the richest and most important finds from a Bronze Age grave in the Stonehenge Landscape to date. The finds were acquired by the museum in 1883 and were displayed there until 1922 when they were indefinitely loaned to the [[British Museum]]. After a controversial [[Conservation-restoration|restoration]] of the largest piece that may not reflect its original finish, the pieces were returned to Devizes in 1985.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Caple|first1=Chris|author1-link=Chris Caple|title=Conservation Skills: Judgement, Method and Decision Making|date=2000|publisher=Routledge|isbn=0415188814}}</ref> They are on display in the Gold from the Time of Stonehenge exhibition, opened in 2013.<ref>{{cite web|title=Stonehenge period gold on display at Wiltshire Heritage Museum|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-wiltshire-24519846|website=BBC News|accessdate=20 October 2015|date=14 October 2013}}</ref>
The natural history collection includes remains of a [[plesiosaur]] called [[Bathyspondylus]] found at [[Swindon]] in 1774. ''Bathyspondylus swindoniensis'' was first described in 1982 from the Museum's specimens.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dinosauria.com/dml/names/ples.html |title= ''Plesiosauria Translation and Pronunciation Guide'' at dinosauria.com |accessdate=29 October 2009}}</ref>
In 2010 the Museum ran a community bus service, the [http://www.stonehenge-avebury-bus.org.uk Henge Hopper], linking [[Avebury]] with [[Amesbury]] and [[Stonehenge]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Bus from Avebury to Devizes circles historic sites|url=http://www.gazetteandherald.co.uk/news/towns/marlboroughheadlines/9009111.Bus_from_Avebury_to_Devizes_circles_historic_sites/|website=Gazette & Herald|accessdate=20 October 2015|location=Marlborough|date=5 May 2011}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Bush Barrow]] *[[Cunetio Hoard]] *[[Lacock Cup]] *[[Marden Henge]] *[[Stonehenge and Avebury World Heritage Site]] *[[The Salisbury Museum]] *[[Wiltshire Record Society]]
